meanings.definition: Treat in an indulgent or overprotective way.
meanings.sent1: She coddles her pet cat by giving it extra treats and cuddles.
meanings.sent2: The mother coddles her baby by always carrying him around.
meanings.sent3: He coddles his plants by talking to them every day.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy woman coddles her dog with diamond-studded collars.
meanings.sent5: The teacher coddles her students by allowing them extra time for assignments.

meanings.definition: Cook (an egg) in water below boiling point.
meanings.sent1: She coddles the egg gently in the warm water.
meanings.sent2: To make a perfect soft-boiled egg, you need to coddle it just right.
meanings.sent3: He coddles the egg as if it were a delicate treasure.
meanings.sent4: The chef coddles the egg with precision to achieve the desired consistency.
meanings.sent5: Coddling the egg slowly ensures a creamy yolk.

meanings.sent1: The grandparents coddle their grandchildren with gifts and sweets.
meanings.sent2: She coddles her best friend on her birthday with a spa day.
meanings.sent3: He coddles his girlfriend by surprising her with flowers every week.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity is coddled by assistants who cater to her every whim.
meanings.sent5: Coddling a loved one can sometimes lead to them taking things for granted.
